speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Brothers and sisters, at this Easter time we focus on the glorious Resurrection of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. We remember His loving invitation to “come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: “Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: “For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.” 1

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The Savior’s invitation to come unto Him is an invitation to all not only to come unto Him but also to belong to His Church.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: In the verse preceding this loving invitation, Jesus teaches how this is done by seeking to follow Him. He declared, “No man [or woman] knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man [or woman] the Father, save the Son, and he [or she] to whomsoever the Son will reveal him.” 2

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Jesus wants us to know God is a loving Heavenly Father.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Knowing that we are loved by our Heavenly Father will help us know who we are and know that we belong to His great eternal family.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The Mayo Clinic recently noted: “Having a sense of belonging is so important. … Nearly every aspect of our lives is organized around belonging to something.” This report adds, “We cannot separate the importance of a sense of belonging from our physical and mental health” 3 —and, I would add, our spiritual health.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: On the evening before His suffering in Gethsemane and death on the cross, the Savior met with His disciples for the Last Supper. He said to them, “In the world ye shall have tribulation : but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.” 4 Before sunset the following day, Jesus Christ had suffered and had “died [on the cross] for our sins.” 5

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: I wonder how lonely the faithful women and men who followed Him must have felt in Jerusalem as the sun set and darkness and fear encompassed them. 6

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Like these ancient disciples nearly 2,000 years ago, many of you may also feel lonely from time to time. I have experienced this loneliness since the death of my precious wife, Barbara, over two and a half years ago. I know what it is to be surrounded by family members, friends, and associates but still feel lonely—because the love of my life is no longer here beside me.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted this sense of isolation and loneliness for many. Nevertheless, despite the challenges we face in life, we can, like on that first Easter morning, awake to a new life in Christ, with new and marvelous possibilities and new realities as we turn to the Lord for hope and belonging.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: I personally feel the pain of those who lack a sense of belonging. As I watch news from around the world, I see many who seem to be experiencing this loneliness. I think that, for many, it is because they may not know that they are loved by Heavenly Father and that we all belong to His eternal family. Believing that God loves us and that we are His children is comforting and assuring.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Because we are the spirit children of God, everyone has a divine origin, nature, and potential. Each of us “is a beloved spirit son or daughter of heavenly parents.” 7 This is our identity! This is who we really are!

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Our spiritual identity is enhanced as we understand our many mortal identities, including ethnic, cultural, or national heritage.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: This sense of spiritual and cultural identity, love, and belonging can inspire hope and love for Jesus Christ.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: I speak of hope in Christ not as wishful thinking. Instead, I speak of hope as an expectation that will be realized. Such hope is essential to overcoming adversity, fostering spiritual resilience and strength, and coming to know that we are loved by our Eternal Father and that we are His children, who belong to His family.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: When we have hope in Christ, we come to know that as we need to make and keep sacred covenants, our fondest desires and dreams can be fulfilled through Him.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles have counseled together in a spirit of prayer and with a yearning to understand how to help all who feel alone or feel they don’t belong. We long to help all who feel this way. Let me mention, in particular, those who are currently single.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Brothers and sisters, more than half of adults in the Church today are widowed, divorced, or not yet married. Some wonder about their opportunities and place in God’s plan and in the Church. We should understand that eternal life is not simply a question of current marital status but of discipleship and being “valiant in the testimony of Jesus.” 8 The hope of all who are single is the same as for all members of the Lord’s restored Church—access to the grace of Christ through “obedience to the laws and ordinances of the Gospel.” 9

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: May I suggest that there are some important principles we need to understand.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: First, scriptures and latter-day prophets confirm that everyone who is faithful in keeping gospel covenants will have the opportunity for exaltation . President Russell M. Nelson taught: “In the Lord’s own way and time, no blessing will be withheld from His faithful Saints. The Lord will judge and reward each individual according to heartfelt desire as well as deed.” 10

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Second, the precise time and manner in which the blessings of exaltation are bestowed have not all been revealed, but they are nonetheless assured . 11 President Dallin H. Oaks explained that some of the circumstances “of mortality will be set right in the Millennium, which is the time for fulfilling all that is incomplete in the great plan of happiness for all of our Father’s worthy children.” 12

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: That doesn’t mean that every blessing is deferred until the Millennium; some have already been received, and others will continue to be received until that day. 13

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Third, waiting upon the Lord implies continued obedience and spiritual progress toward Him . Waiting upon the Lord does not imply biding one’s time. You should never feel like you are in a waiting room.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Waiting upon the Lord implies action. I have learned over the years that our hope in Christ increases when we serve others. Serving as Jesus served, we naturally increase our hope in Him.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The personal growth one can achieve now while waiting upon the Lord and His promises is an invaluable, sacred element of His plan for each one of us. The contributions one can make now to help build up the Church on earth and to gather Israel are much needed. Marital status has nothing to do with one’s capacity to serve. The Lord honors those who serve and wait upon Him in patience and faith. 14

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Fourth, God offers eternal life to all of His children . All those who accept the Savior’s gracious gift of repentance and live His commandments will receive eternal life, even though they do not attain to all its characteristics and perfections in mortality. Those who repent will experience the Lord’s readiness to forgive, as He has assured: “Yea, and as often as my people repent will I forgive them their trespasses against me.” 15

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: In the final analysis, a person’s capacity, desires, and opportunities in matters of agency and choice, including qualification for eternal blessings, are matters only the Lord can judge.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Fifth, our confidence in these assurances is rooted in our faith in Jesus Christ, by whose grace all things pertaining to mortality are set right . 16 All promised blessings are made possible through Him, who, by His Atonement, “descended below all things” 17 and has “overcome the world.” 18 He “hath sat down on the right hand of God, to claim of the Father his rights of mercy which he hath upon the children of men … ; wherefore he advocateth the cause of the children of men.” 19 In the end, “the saints shall be filled with his glory, and receive their inheritance” 20 as “joint-heirs with Christ.” 21

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Our desire is that these principles will help all have increased hope in Christ and feel a sense of belonging.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Never forget that you are a child of God, our Eternal Father, now and forever. He loves you, and the Church wants and needs you. Yes, we need you! We need your voices, talents, skills, goodness, and righteousness.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: For many years, we have talked about “young single adults,” “single adults,” and “adults.” Those designations can be administratively helpful at times but can inadvertently change how we perceive others.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Is there a way to avoid this human tendency that can separate us from one another?

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: President Nelson asked that we refer to ourselves as members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. That seems to cover all of us, doesn’t it?

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: The gospel of Jesus Christ has the power to unite us. We are ultimately more alike than we are different. As members of God’s family, we are truly brothers and sisters. Paul stated, “And [God] hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth.” 22

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: To you stake presidents, bishops, and quorum and sister leaders, I ask you to consider every member of your stake, ward, quorum, or organization as a member who can contribute and serve in callings and participate in many ways.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Every member in our quorums, organizations, wards, and stakes has God-given gifts and talents that can help build up His kingdom now.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: Let us call upon our members who are single to serve, lift, and teach. Disregard old notions and ideas that have sometimes unintentionally contributed to their feelings of loneliness and that they do not belong or cannot serve.

speaker: President M. Russell Ballard
role: Acting President of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
title: Hope in Christ
paragraph_text: I bear my witness on this Easter weekend of our Savior, Jesus Christ, and the eternal hope He gives me and all who believe in His name. And I bear this testimony humbly in His sacred name, even Jesus Christ, amen.
